intro: Pericampylus, commonly known as the silverleaf plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine hairs that reflect light. The plant produces small, daisy-like flowers that are typically yellow or white in color. Pericampylus species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. These plants are sometimes used in ornamental gardening due to their attractive appearance and drought tolerance.
